result.execSummary:
The defendant Riley Clifford Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Burnett County cases 22CF45 and 22CF114

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) All costs, fees, and other surcharges have been paid in full from the bond funds posted in this matter. 
3) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge and waived all other court costs in this matter.
No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
The defendant shall obtain his GED, HSED, or equivalent.

1) The defendant shall obtain a valid driver's license. 
2) The defendant shall apply to the Burnett County Drug Court and, if accepted, successfully complete the program.

Burnett County cases 21CT41, 22CT8, and 22TR123 were DRI.
If the defendant successfully discharges from probation with zero violations, this matter may be expunged from his criminal record.

records.addlTxt: Notice Of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:05 AM Cases 22CF4, 21CT41, 22CF45, 22CF114, 22CF189, 22CT08, 22TR123, and 22TR160 called together.  Defendant Riley Clifford Jones in court.  Attorneys Renee M Taber and Alysja Otten in court for Riley Clifford Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF189 on for initial appearance.  Defense waive preliminary hearing; this case is going to be dismissed outright- was initially intended to be an uncharged read-in.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Cases is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Taber: def pleading to amended Ct 1 in 22CF45: misdemeanor amphetamine, Ct 2 of 22CF04: possession of THC (PTOAC), and 22CF114 Count 3: misdemeanor bail jump; joint recommendation for a withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation and Drug Court.  Per Atty Otten: Def also pleading to RCS in 22TR160 for guidelines.  Court notes if Drug Court is contemplated, she will do imposed/stayed sentence.  State notes that will not change the offer.  Off the record 9:12 AM.  Back on the record 9:13 AM, same appearances.  Defense has discussed the imposed/stayed issue and is ready to continue with the plea/sentencing hearing know that. Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  State moves to amend Count 1 of 22CF45 to misdemeanor possession of amphetamine; Court grants.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enter pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 22CF45 (as amended), Ct 2 of 22CF4, Ct 3 of 22CF114, and 22TR160; and orders a JOC; 22CF189 is dismissed outright; remaining counts and cases are DRI.  Defense requests expungement in all criminal convictions; State not objecting.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney Otten asks Court to accept agreement, asks court to order concurrent sentences.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  Court takes judicial notice of def's criminal history.
Count 1 of 22CF45: possession of amphetamine- 2 yrs probation; 1 year jail imposed/stayed; $200 DNA surcharge
Count 2 of 22CF4: possession of THC- 2 years probation, 6 months jail imposed/stayed consecutive to Count 1 of 22CF4; $200 DNA surcharge
Count 3 of 22CF114: misdemeanor bond jump- 2 years probation, 9 months jail imposed/stayed; $200 DNA surcharge
Conditions of Probation:
No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Def must apply and complete Drug Court if accepted.  GED or HSED or equivalent.  Obtain a valid driver's license.  If the defendant successfully discharges off probation with zero probation violations, each of these criminal matters may be expunged.  Bond to be applied to these court costs, remainder of bond to be applied to def's past-due balance with the Clerk of Courts.  Any leftover bond may be either returned to the bond poster or forwarded to Tessa Anderson to apply to Drug Court costs- def to update Court where to direct those funds by the end of the day.  47 days jail credit, parties have 5 days to update Court if that figure is incorrect.
Count 1 of 22CF160: operate w/restricted controlled substance- 
Fine of $937.50
OWI Assessment and Driver Safety Plan
DL revoked for 6 months
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:40 AM Cases 21CT41, 2022CF000004, 2022CF000045, 2022CF000114, 2022CF000189, 2022CT000008, 2022TR000123, 2022TR000160 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley Clifford Jones in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten and Renee Taber appear in court for Riley Clifford Jones. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: def programming continues, contemplating Drug Court, likely to resolve.  Case 22CF189 is set for initial appearance (no attorney appointed to that matter yet).  Court prints criminal complaint, court adjourns the initial appearance.
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Def to talk to Tessa Anderson to learn about Drug Court.  Bond continues.
State's Discovery Demand

Bond to cover Burnett County cases 21CT41, 22CF04, 22CT08, 22CF45, and 22CF114.  No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No contact with JT, RO, RJB, RB Jr., KLB, or IM.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  Defendant is to be released only to his mother and is to be driven directly to the treatment facility.  Defendant is not to leave the treatment facility for any reason without facilitator supervision, must remain at treatment at all times. If he leaves the treatment facility for any reason other than graduation, he must immediately return to the jail to assess bond.  No driving without a valid driver's license.  Defendant must be supervised at all times.  If the defendant graduates from in-patient treatment, he will be allowed to progress through the treatment program into their sober living facility/program.  When discharged from the sober living facility, the defendant may be transported by his mother to his mother's residence.
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:26 AM Cases 2021TR000228, 2021TR000229, 2022CF000004, 2022CF000045, 2022CF000114, 2022CT000008, 2022TR000123, 2022TR000160, and 21CT41 called together. Attys Alysja Otten and Renee Taber both appear on behalf of the defendant. Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley Clifford Jones appeared by video.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Riley Clifford Jones. Motion recently filed in 22CF114, Atty Otten argues to allow def to continue programming.  State responds, not objecting.  Court will amend bond.  Bond will be sent to the facility for signature.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Previous $10k additional cash converted to a signature component.  Bond to cover Burnett County cases 21CT41, 22CF04, 22CT08, 22CF45, and 22GF116 (now 22CF114).  No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No contact with JT, RO, RJB, RB Jr, KB, or IM. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  Defendant is to be released only to his mother and is to be driven directly to the treatment facility.  Defendant is not to leave the treatment facility for any reason without facilitator supervision, must remain at treatment at all times. If he leaves the treatment facility for any reason, be it discharge, graduation, etc, he must immediately return to the jail to assess bond.  No driving without a valid driver's license.  Defendant must be supervised at all times.  When discharged or if he leaves treatment for any reason, the defendant must be transported back to jail by his mother.

03:10 PM Cases 21CT41, 22CF4, 22CF45, 22CF114, 22CT8, and 22TR123, 22TR160 called together.  Defendant Riley Clifford Jones in court with attorney Alysja Otten.  Defendant in custody appearing from Douglas County Jail.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Riley Clifford Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case 22CF114 set for preliminary hearing, but proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Atty Otten reserves on motions to next Status, granted, proceeds to arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Otten argues in support of motion to modify bond.  Witness appears, provides programming information at the request of the judge.  State responds- not opposed to modification of bail to allow for programming, but requests various conditions of bond.  Court will allow def to be released, converts remaining $10k to signature bond- be released only to his mother to be driven directly to the treatment facility, def is not to leave the treatment facility for any reason without facilitator supervision, must remain at treatment at all times, if leaves program for any reason- discharge, graduation, etc, he must immediately return to the jail to assess bond.  No driving without a valid driver's license.  Def must be supervised at all times.  When discharged or leaves treatment for any reason, must be transported back to jail by mother.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Arraignment on March 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:13 PM Cases 22CF04, 21CT41, 21TR228, 22CF45, 22CT8, 22TR14, and 22TR123 called together. Defendant Riley Clifford Jones in court with attorney Alysja Otten.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF04 on for Initial Appearance. Court makes record regarding motions. State filed amended criminal complaints to cure issues. Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. NG pleas entered to misdmeanors. Preliminary Hearings set in 22CF04 and 22CF45. State calls first witness in 22CF4, Detective Mikal Anton, who is sworn in and testifies. The witness has identified the defendant. Venue is made. Atty Otten crosses. ADA Schmidt redirects. Atty Otten recrosses. Witness steps down. Court does not need argument.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings. Case 22CF45 proceeds to preliminary hearing. State recalls Deputy Mikal Anton, who remains sworn in and testifies. Identity has been stipulated to. Venue is made. Atty Otten crosses. No redirect. Witness steps down. No further witnesses. Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it. The matter is bound over for further proceedings. The State will file informations in 22CF04 and 22CF45 today mirroring complaints. Cases 22CF4, 21CT41, 21TR228, 22CF45, and 22CT8 were scheduled for motion hearings on defendant's motion to modify bond. Atty Otten argues in support of motion for signature bond. ADA Schmidt argues to keep a cash portion of bond. Court takes judicial notice of delinquency cases, makes record. Court denies bond motion.
  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
